adrFormatAddress: 1711 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

editorialSummary.text: Counter-service deli chain crafting hearty signature subs, salads & kids' meals in a casual setting.

originalText.text:
Quick and delicious cheesesteak. If you are super hungry or sharing with 2 people, get the large. Else, the medium is just right for one person.

I enjoy that the bread isn't super toasted and has a nice inside to soak up all the meat juices.

Recommendation: get the classic cheesesteak with both the sweet and hot peppers. The peppers adds a nice kick that isn't too spicy contrasting from the savory cheese and meat.

text.text:

originalText.text:
Used to really like their sandwiches but the quality has gone down. The bread is stale, the flavor is gone. My favorite used to be the seasonal French dip, but upon ordering it recently I received no more than a tablespoon of the au jus. Since it was a to-go order I didn’t realize this until I was at work.

The staffing clearly has a high turnover rate and most of the time they are understaffed for the demand during lunch hours. Some of the workers have been very kind.

originalText.text: We saw Capriotti's open in the city and we decided to check it out. We heard they make sandwiches out of Wagyu and we couldn't help ourselves to get some. Wagyu is one of our favorite meats and we were surprised that they had American wagyu so we decided to order all of them. The American wagyu Cheesesteak was our favorite! The Beef was rich, buttery flavor, and tender. Then you get that kick of the creamy and salty flavor of the cheese. We loved it! Then add onions and bell peppers, and add a crunchy and slightly sweet taste to it too! As for the American, Wagyu Roast Beef was juicy and succulent. The beef just melts in the mouth. It was satisfying compared to any other type of roast beef. Lastly, we enjoyed the American Wagyu Slaw Be Jo with the coleslaw which contributed a crunchy and slightly sweet taste. Together with the beef, it was refreshing and crunchy.

Together with the beef, it was refreshing and crunchy.

originalText.text: Ordered this bad boy for my brother since he had a cold. Nothing but praise for this place. The sandwich was reasonably priced (massive Philly $25), especially for NYC and was massive. Arrived perfect shape with a massive cookie. You can order the large and if you’re not a big eater you have three or four sandwiches. Will definitely try again!

text.text: Ordered this bad boy for my brother since he had a cold. Nothing but praise for this place. The sandwich was reasonably priced (massive Philly $25), especially for NYC and was massive. originalText.text: I'm a picky eater but this is definitely one of my FAV sandwich shops!  I love the philly cheesesteak and classic italian the most. For soup, I loved the clam chowder. Sandwiches are big portion sizes and very delicious. Half is enough to fill me up. I really recommend this place for anyone in the area. Also, the people behind this shop are amazing humans!
